Nate Lant

11/8/2019

While it is reported that there are 25 million americans with disabilities, only __________ percent of them use a wheelchair

# household income distribution 
nhts_persons %>%
  left_join(nhts_households, by = "houseid") %>%
  mutate(wheelchair = ifelse(w_chair == "07" | w_mtrchr == "08", TRUE, FALSE)) %>%
  group_by(wheelchair, hhfaminc) %>% 
  tally() %>%
  filter(hhfaminc > 0) %>%
  spread(wheelchair, n, fill = 0)   # it would also be cool to figure out the weighted portions to get full count histograms.
## # A tibble: 11 x 3
##    hhfaminc                  `FALSE` `TRUE`
##    <chr+lbl>                   <dbl>  <dbl>
##  1 01 [Less than $10,000]      10013    383
##  2 02 [$10,000 to $14,999]      9644    386
##  3 03 [$15,000 to $24,999]     18560    477
##  4 04 [$25,000 to $34,999]     21335    450
##  5 05 [$35,000 to $49,999]     28764    458
##  6 06 [$50,000 to $74,999]     45076    484
##  7 07 [$75,000 to $99,999]     36545    232
##  8 08 [$100,000 to $124,999]   29851    175
##  9 09 [$125,000 to $149,999]   17170     74
## 10 10 [$150,000 to $199,999]   17360     78
## 11 11 [$200,000 or more]       18671     73
# worker status yes or no
nhts_persons %>% 
  filter(r_age > 18 & r_age < 64) %>%
  mutate(wheelchair = ifelse(w_chair == "07" | w_mtrchr == "08", TRUE, FALSE)) %>%
  group_by(wheelchair, worker) %>% 
  tally() %>%
  filter(worker > 0) %>%
  spread(wheelchair, n, fill = 0)
## # A tibble: 2 x 3
##   worker    `FALSE` `TRUE`
##   <chr+lbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>
## 1 01 [Yes]   110587    123
## 2 02 [No]     38039    920
# using wkftpt full time or part time employment
nhts_persons %>% 
  filter(r_age > 18 & r_age < 64) %>%
  mutate(wheelchair = ifelse(w_chair == "07" | w_mtrchr == "08", TRUE, FALSE)) %>%
  group_by(wheelchair, wkftpt) %>% 
  tally() %>%
  filter(wkftpt > 0) %>%
  spread(wheelchair, n, fill = 0)
## # A tibble: 2 x 3
##   wkftpt         `FALSE` `TRUE`
##   <chr+lbl>        <dbl>  <dbl>
## 1 01 [Full-time]   88767     57
## 2 02 [Part-time]   17633     38
# HHVEHCNT - count of vehicle per household
nhts_persons %>%
  left_join(nhts_households, by = "houseid") %>%
  mutate(wheelchair = ifelse(w_chair == "07" | w_mtrchr == "08", TRUE, FALSE)) %>%
  group_by(wheelchair, hhvehcnt) %>% 
  tally() %>%
  filter(hhvehcnt > 0) %>%
  spread(wheelchair, n, fill = 0) # How many persons are in these households? and is this counting persons or households?
## # A tibble: 12 x 3
##    hhvehcnt `FALSE` `TRUE`
##       <dbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>
##  1        1   57535   1275
##  2        2  110502   1004
##  3        3   51527    407
##  4        4   21143    161
##  5        5    7377     51
##  6        6    2772     24
##  7        7    1015      5
##  8        8     413      6
##  9        9     196      1
## 10       10      95      2
## 11       11      48      0
## 12       12      82      0
# VEHOWNED - Own vehicle longer than one year (can't find a more straightforward vehicle ownership variable)
nhts_persons %>%
  left_join(nhts_vehicles, by = "houseid") %>%
  mutate(wheelchair = ifelse(w_chair == "07" | w_mtrchr == "08", TRUE, FALSE)) %>%
  group_by(wheelchair, vehowned) %>% 
  tally() %>%
  filter(vehowned > 0) %>%
  spread(wheelchair, n, fill = 0) # how do we get more than 3410 wheelchair?
## # A tibble: 2 x 3
##   vehowned  `FALSE` `TRUE`
##   <chr+lbl>   <dbl>  <dbl>
## 1 01 [Yes]   497628   4856
## 2 02 [No]     86725    683
